formState.extractPrompt: Extract the maker, model, error code, error type, possible cause, and troubleshooting steps for all boiler makes and models from the fault code pages.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Venting program active when power turned on / interrupted (runs for 7 mins)
No flame after 5 ignition attempts. This could be down to your condensate drain pipe freezing.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: A frozen condensate pipe is something that is often easily fixed.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Fan error or control unit defective (speed control is not achieved)
Return greater than flow – flow temperature increases too fast
Return probe error – could be damanged
Outdoor sensor error – could be damaged
Central heating flow switch is open
Fan fault – fan isn’t starting up
Pressure greater than 3 bar or pump pressure increase is too high
Pressure less than 1 bar or pump pressure increase too low (no pump detection).
Maximum flow temperature exceeded, Flow temperature rise rate too high, Excessive difference between flow and return temperature
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check system circulation & pump operation. Check demands for boiler operation (switched live operation). Check temperature setting. Check temperature sensors in boiler.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: BL terminals on User Interaction Controller are open circuit
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: If condensate pump is wired to these terminals check operation of condensate pump. Check wiring to BL terminals (link present or connections to external device correct).
Check gas supply is turned on and gas is available if on a pre-payment meter. Check flue condition.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Bad connection or wiring fault. Internal communication fault.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check wiring/connections between boiler and User Interaction Controller and within the box. If necessary replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Parameter error or faulty PU. Configuration error or PCB fault.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Internal fault in combustion control unit
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Bad connection to flow or return temperature sensor. Fault with flow or return temperature sensor(s). Low or no flow through boiler. Reverse flow through boiler.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check connections to temperature sensors/PCB and condition of wiring loom. Check resistance of temperature sensors. Check pump operation and system circulation.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Over-temperature thermostat on heat exchanger activated. No water flow through heat exchanger. Over-temperature thermostat fault or bad connection (open circuit). PCB over-temperature condition. Flue fault resulting in recirculation or activation of air pressure switch (if fitted).
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check connections to and operation of O/T thermostat and air pressure switch (if fitted) and PCB and condition of wiring loom. Check system pressure or that system is not air-locked. Check pump operation and system circulation. Check flue condition.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: No ignition. No flame detected following ignition. False flame signal detected. Repeated loss of flame detected.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check earthing of the appliance. Check ignition electrode condition and clean/replace if necessary. Check gas valve operation. Check flue condition. Check correct combustion/gas valve settings. Check condensate drain for blockage.
If fan operates, check flue installation and condition. Replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Bad connection to PU. Parameter error or faulty PU.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check PCB and condition of wiring loom. Replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Bad connection or wiring fault internal or external to the boiler. Parameter error. Communication error.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Check all wiring connections are correctly made. Using a service tool or Recom software check all parameter settings. Replace combustion control unit.

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Ignition failure – the boiler has attempted to light 5 times and not succeeded – check the gas supply is on
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Ignition failure – the boiler has attempted to light 5 times and not succeeded – check the gas supply is on

boiler_faults.possible_cause: False flame – possibly a problem with the power supply
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: False flame – possibly a problem with the power supply

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Boiler overheat – check that any valves to the heating circuit have not been shut down, no air in the system and that the water pressure is correct
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Boiler overheat – check that any valves to the heating circuit have not been shut down, no air in the system and that the water pressure is correct

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Fan failure – boiler cannot detect fan rotation – check fan operation and both connectors onto fan
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Fan failure – boiler cannot detect fan rotation – check fan operation and both connectors onto fan

boiler_faults.possible_cause: Flue overheat – check combustion and flue temperature vs. return temperature – the flue temperature should be no more than 10C above return temperature. Possible heat exchanger fault.
boiler_faults.troubleshooting: Flue overheat – check combustion and flue temperature vs. return temperature – the flue temperature should be no more than 10C above return temperature. Possible heat exchanger fault.
